CatDescriptText: Joe Harris, delivery man, 2060 Bentley Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 6 with question: "With Mayor Lawrence performing his duties as Governor in Harrisburg, do you believe the Democratic party in Pittsburgh will be weakened by his absence?" answer reads: "Yes, I think so.  Mayor Lawrence is a good man and it will be hard for someone to fill his shoes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joe Harris wearing dark hat with cord band, plaid shirt, and dark coat, standing in front of ridged metal wall with other people and large window with man at microphone on the left, possibly a radio station
